{/* top bar */}

Beer City Dog Biscuits

Home / Portfolio / BCDB

Winter 2019 | Project Manager

Client Description

BCDB is a 501(c)3 non-profit that aims to benefit developmentally disabled adults through their business model and hiring structure as well as donations of their proceeds. Through selling hand-made dog biscuits, BCDB is able to employ developmentally disabled adults as a message and action of empowerment to the disabled community. These employees are dubbed ‘Brew Bakers’.

Project Scope

    (a) Potential market entry analysis to help decide new geographical locations to sell in, considering market interest, retailer agreements, and logistical constraints
    (b) Given market entry potential, conduct operations analysis to better understand and maximize labor and facility capabilitiess
    (c) Social media campaign framework to spread awareness about unique value proposition and any new potential markets

Team

Ali Ahmed, Minnie Sun, Neena Baliga, Ryan Kellett

Tools

Tableau, Excel, Powerpoint

 

 

 

 

{/*timeline*/}

. . .

Timeline

{/*methodology*/}

. . .

Methodology

{/*cost benefit analysis*/}

Competitive Analysis

Gave us an idea of what similar market alternatives to client were and weren’t offering, which allowed us to better ideate new product ideas to meet market expectations and create new venture opportunities

 

Student Surveys

Engaged with students at Michigan, a representative user group of client, to understand what their needs, pain points, and goals were in an e-newsletter

 

Market Sizing

Estimated size of each considered niche product by making assumptions on penetration rates, user base populations, stickiness factors, etc.

 

Pricing and Cost Analysis

Built financial model projecting market size and lifetime value (LTV) for each niche newsletter recommendation, including assumptions such as open rates, cost per impression (CPM), unsubscribe rates, customer acquisition costs (CAC), and revenue per customer

{/*deliverable recommendations*/}

. . .

Deliverable Recommendations

(1) Recommended 3 niche newsletters

of which 2 relating to retail and technology have been implemented by client
